instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.GPUVCORE_EN: What is GPUVCORE_EN? GPUVCORE_EN enables GPU VCORE when it is high, a power rail necessary for the GPU to function so you can get an image on the screen. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.PPVCORE_GPU: What is PPVCORE_GPU? This is the main power rail for the GPU. This is required for the GPU to turn on so you can get image on the display. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - MBP 15" 2012 Retina - Dead GPU??
threads.message:
someone used a heat gun on the GPU :( poor little board [IMG type="full" width="200px"]https://i.imgur.com/IjKmeYv.jpg[/IMG]
 


The internal display is not working, no backlight, no picture.
i get video on the external display, also i get some kernel panic reports sometimes, apps like Chess and Heaven won't open.
it seems like GPU is not turning on in OSX but its using the intel.
[IMG type="full" width="200px"]https://i.imgur.com/PCHpC8K.jpg[/IMG]
 



I've re-flowed the <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> with new solder already but haven't try replace.

can i confirm if the GPU is dead or do i have a bad <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> ?


<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> = 3.4v
<SIGNAL>GPUVCORE_EN</SIGNAL> = 3.2v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - MBP 15" 2012 Retina - Dead GPU??
threads.message:
Judging by the green shit they also used Chine battery acid flux. Is GPU shorted? This will probably end up with pulling and recalling the GPU and VRAM.

Also I'm pretty sure the Thunderbolt port only works through the Nvidia GPU, so check if the GPU is even detected by OSX

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - MBP 15" 2012 Retina - Dead GPU??
threads.message: Yes, osx can see the Nvidia GPU but it doesnt use it. When i try to run GPU apps, it just wont open.Gfxcardstaus wont let me select Nvidia.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - MBP 15" 2012 Retina - Dead GPU??
threads.message: I bet it is the shitty Chinese battery acid that got under the GPU and possible other chips in the area. Clean all that crap up and add some real flux and try to clear all the acid from under the chips with some heat and flux.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - MBP 15" 2012 Retina - Dead GPU??
threads.message:
replaced <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>, cleaning up GPU area, used real flux with some heat and last run thru USC and still didn't work.

[IMG type="full" width="200px"]https://i.imgur.com/28qC1Xx.jpg[/IMG]

would GPU reball work or need a replacement GPU chip?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - MBP 15" 2012 Retina - Dead GPU??
threads.message: I would reball first. Also check for missing or damaged resistors/caps around the GPU. It could also be a MUX problem if flux got under that chip too. Is GPU Vcore present now?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - MBP 15" 2012 Retina - Dead GPU??
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL> = 0.9v
L8360 = 1.36v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0GPU</SIGNAL> = 3.3

i'v replaced <CHIP>U9100</CHIP>, external still working, ASD still failed same test.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - MBP 15" 2012 Retina - Dead GPU??
threads.message: Put another GPU on there and inspect for missing components. I dunno man, fucked up boards like these are always a huge waste of time.
